### Details on the map elements 

Written description of the features on the map. 

#### County Level Features 

All county level features report information that as aggregated to the county level. This include text reference to the county (state/county) and spatial point reference that occur within the county. 

- <strong> Counties with a record </strong> : This is a binary presence absence map that shows if a specific county has at least one record of the the species from across all evaluated sources. 

- <strong> Sum of records within County </strong> : This layer depicts the total number of unique records of a species across all sources within a county.

- <strong> Counties listed in USDA Plants and/or Bonap Only  </strong> : These counties only contain a reference from USDA Plants and/or BONAP. There are no identified observation, herberium, or germplasm records from these counties.  

- <strong> Counties with one or more Herbarium or Germplasm record </strong> : These counties has at least one herbarium and/or germplasm occurrence. There may be additional record sources within this county. 

- <strong> Counties with observational records only </strong> : These counties only have species records from observational datasources such as INaturalist.  

#### Spatial Data Occurrence Features 

The spatial data occurrence features are location records with valid latitude and longitude values. As such, all these features are shown on the the map as point locations. 


-  <strong>Location based Germplasm Records </strong>: Occurrence data with living specimens stored in genebanks or 
botanical gardens 

-  <strong>Location based Herbarium Records with web url </strong>: Occurrence data with associated herbarium specimens. That includes a web visable reference for the herbarium records. 

-  <strong>Location based Herbarium Records without web url </strong>: Occurrence data with associated herbarium specimens. No web visable reference for the herbarium records is included. 

-  <strong>Location Based Observation data </strong>: Validated records from INaturalist. Only research grade observations are used. These observations are approve as correctly identified by at least two other member of the online community. 


### General Methods 

#### Gathering Data

Data was gathered at the Genus level from the following 

**public repositories**

- Seinet 
- Genesys
- Wiews
- GRIN 
- USDA Plants 
- Crop Wild Relative 2020 publication 

**Sourced through communication with data owners** 

- 2023 Botanical Garden Survey 
- BONAP
- IUNC 

#### Data Standardization and Taxonomy 

**data standardization** : All data sets were altered to matched a standard data structure. The specific translation of data sets can be seen [here](https://github.com/dcarver1/cwr_wildgrapes/tree/main/preprocessing). The compileInputDatasets.r and the specific functions within the functions folder. 



**Taxonomy**: The full synonyms cross walk can be viewed [here](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1ZzKUr2GI8wZe42G-nnMZ3iyhUnnqn3OUCMK_0sFKniQ/edit?usp=drive_link). 



#### Spatial Reference 

When latitude and longitude data is present for a record this information was used to assign the state/country. When valid latitude and longitude values were not provide the state and county reference information was pulled from the attribute data associated with the record. If no valid county information was included in the attribute data, the record was not used within this analysis. 


#### Flora of North America 

If state level distribution information was provided for a given specific species, that information was used to filter the states in which counties are evaluated.

## Data exluded by FNA state filter

If the species state level range has been defined by the Flora of North America, then all spatial data has been clip to the that extent. The table below shows the occurrence data that has been removed by the FNA filter.

**The following States are included in the FNA description** : `r if(fna1[1]!="no"){all_states$name}else{"Not included in FNA"}`

```{r fna exclusion, echo=FALSE, message=FALSE, warning=FALSE}
if(fna1[1]=="no"){
  print("This species is not present in the Flora of North America")
}else{
  fnaFiltered <- occFNAFilter |>
    dplyr::mutate(
    link = paste0("https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLScCTcg6ITFMXs9QpQEAvN92GI06wtSTiGSTcUBrOK6E2kChjw/viewform?usp=pp_url&entry.1016353547=",
    taxon,
    "&entry.764274277=",
    countyFIPS,
    "&entry.763749150=",
    state,
    "&entry.1585476570=",
    county,
    "&entry.1304312867=",
    recordID))  |>
    dplyr::mutate(
      "report issue" = paste0("<a target='_blank', href=\"", link , "\">", "link", "</a>"),
    )|>
    dplyr::select(
    "taxon",
    "state",
    "county",
    "databaseSource",
    "collectionSource",
    "type",
    "report issue link" = link,
    "localityInformation",
    "yearRecorded",
    "latitude",
    "longitude")


DT::datatable(fnaFiltered,
            rownames = FALSE,
            width = "100%",
            filter = c("top"),
            escape = TRUE
            )
  
}
```
